keyMoments.title: Zoro Confronts T Bone
keyMoments.description: Zoro encounters Marine Captain T Bone on the sea train tracks and prepares to fight him.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up Zoro's demonstration of his increased strength and debuts a new technique.

keyMoments.title: Debuts Gyuki Yuzume
keyMoments.description: Zoro counters T Bone's attack with Gyuki Yuzume, a Three Sword Style technique that shatters T Bone's sword.
keyMoments.significance: Introduction of a powerful new Santoryu technique that demonstrates Zoro's growth in strength.

keyMoments.title: Defeats T Bone
keyMoments.description: Zoro easily defeats T Bone, sending him into the water, and boards the Rocketman to continue the pursuit.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Zoro's current power level and readiness for stronger opponents.

abilities.description: A Three Sword Style technique where Zoro positions all three swords pointing at the enemy and lunges forward with great impact. Also known as Bull Ogre Brave Claw.

reveals.information: Demonstrates significant growth by easily defeating a Marine captain capable of cutting Sea Kings

keyMoments.title: Facial Technique Barrage
keyMoments.description: Sanji unleashes a series of precise facial kicks named after French words for facial features, temporarily transforming Wanze's face.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Sanji's surgical precision in combat and introduces multiple new techniques.
keyMoments.quote: You're guilty of three sins: You called yourself a 'chef' in front of me, you were disrespectful toward your food, and you insulted my friend!

keyMoments.title: Parage Shot Debuts
keyMoments.description: Sanji's Parage Shot technique temporarily transforms Wanze's face into a beautiful appearance.
keyMoments.significance: First use of a technique that later becomes important in the Thriller Bark arc.

keyMoments.title: Defeats Wanze
keyMoments.description: Sanji defeats Wanze with Santen Découpage, sending him flying through train cars into the CP9 car.
keyMoments.significance: Removes one obstacle and brings Sanji closer to Robin.

keyMoments.title: Faces CP9
keyMoments.description: After defeating Wanze, Sanji faces the full CP9 roster alongside Franky.
keyMoments.significance: First direct confrontation with CP9 on the Puffing Tom.

abilities.description: A precise kick to the eye area. Part of Sanji's facial attack techniques.
A precise kick to the nose. Part of Sanji's facial attack techniques.
A precise kick to the cheek. Part of Sanji's facial attack techniques.
A precise kick to the mouth. Part of Sanji's facial attack techniques.
A precise kick to the teeth. Part of Sanji's facial attack techniques.
A precise kick to the chin. Part of Sanji's facial attack techniques.
A series of precise facial kicks that temporarily reshape the target's face into a handsome appearance. Later used on Duval in Thriller Bark.
A powerful three-part kick technique used as a finishing move.

reveals.information: Shows deep professional pride as a chef, becoming angry when opponents disrespect food or call themselves chefs undeservingly
Explicitly states that insulting his friend (Robin) is one of Wanze's unforgivable sins

keyMoments.title: Ultimate Hammer Debuts
keyMoments.description: Franky tricks Nero and uses Ultimate Hammer to smash him through the train roof.
keyMoments.significance: First appearance of one of Franky's signature attacks.

keyMoments.title: Defeats Nero
keyMoments.description: Franky defeats the CP9 trainee Nero, proving his combat capabilities.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Franky's strength and strategic fighting style.

keyMoments.title: Faces CP9
keyMoments.description: After defeating Nero, Franky faces the full CP9 roster alongside Sanji.
keyMoments.significance: First direct confrontation with CP9 on the Puffing Tom.

abilities.description: A powerful attack where Franky locks down the opponent and smashes them with tremendous force.

reveals.information: Demonstrates ability to defeat a CP9 trainee using strategy and cyborg enhancements

keyMoments.title: Uses Chokkaku Hicho: Bone Odori
keyMoments.description: T Bone unleashes his signature Right Angle Fencing technique against Zoro.
keyMoments.significance: Showcases T Bone's unique fighting style and powerful slashing abilities.

keyMoments.title: Defeated by Zoro
keyMoments.description: T Bone's sword is shattered by Zoro's Gyuki Yuzume and he is defeated, falling into the water.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the power gap between regular Marines and the Straw Hats at this point in the story.

abilities.description: Right Angle Flying Bird: Bone Dance - a powerful angular slash attack using Right Angle Fencing technique, capable of cutting through ships and Sea Kings.

reveals.information: Shown to be ashamed of falling into a trap and dedicated to his duty to catch the Puffing Tom
Capable of cutting Sea Kings in half with his sword techniques

keyMoments.title: Demonstrates Ramen Kenpo
keyMoments.description: Wanze shows his bizarre ramen-based fighting techniques against Sanji.
keyMoments.significance: Showcases one of the more unusual fighting styles in One Piece.

keyMoments.title: Face Transformed by Parage Shot
keyMoments.description: Sanji's Parage Shot temporarily transforms Wanze's face into a handsome appearance, which Wanze finds horrifying.
keyMoments.significance: Creates a memorable comedic moment and introduces Sanji's face-reshaping technique.

keyMoments.title: Defeated by Sanji
keyMoments.description: Wanze is defeated by Sanji's Santen Découpage and sent flying into the CP9 car.
keyMoments.significance: Removes one obstacle between Sanji and Robin.

abilities.description: A unique combat style utilizing ramen noodles produced from the user's nose as weapons and armor.
Knife throwing technique used in Wanze's fighting style.

reveals.information: Uses bizarre ramen-based martial arts produced from nose hairs

keyMoments.title: Demonstrates Partial Rokushiki
keyMoments.description: Nero reveals he has mastered only four of the six Rokushiki techniques, using Rankyaku and Geppo against Franky.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Nero as an incomplete CP9 agent, foreshadowing his fate.

keyMoments.title: Defeated by Franky
keyMoments.description: Nero is defeated by Franky's Ultimate Hammer and crashes into the CP9 car.
keyMoments.significance: His defeat leads directly to his execution by Lucci.

keyMoments.title: Executed by Rob Lucci
keyMoments.description: Rob Lucci judges Nero too weak for CP9 and executes him with multiple Shigan strikes before throwing him into the ocean.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes CP9's ruthless nature and the consequences of weakness in the organization. Nero's presumed death is a shocking moment.

statusHistory.note: Severely injured and thrown into ocean during Aqua Laguna; presumed dead

affiliations.note: Expelled and executed for being too weak

abilities.description: One of the six Rokushiki techniques allowing high-speed movement.
One of the six Rokushiki techniques allowing the user to kick off the air itself to gain altitude.
One of the six Rokushiki techniques making the body flexible to dodge attacks.
One of the six Rokushiki techniques creating air slashes with kicks.
A variation of Rankyaku creating a linear air slash.

reveals.information: Has only mastered four of the six Rokushiki techniques, lacking Tekkai and Shigan
Executed by Rob Lucci for being too weak for CP9 and thrown into the ocean

keyMoments.title: Executes Nero
keyMoments.description: Lucci coldly judges Nero as too weak for CP9 and executes him with Shigan before throwing him into the ocean.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Lucci's ruthless nature and CP9's merciless standards, raising the stakes for the Straw Hats.
keyMoments.quote: He's too weak. He only knows four of the forms.

keyMoments.title: Confronts Sanji and Franky
keyMoments.description: After executing Nero, Lucci and the other CP9 agents face off against Sanji and Franky.
keyMoments.significance: First direct confrontation between Lucci and the Straw Hats' allies on the Puffing Tom.

reveals.information: Demonstrates extreme ruthlessness by executing his own teammate for being weak
Shows that CP9 has no tolerance for weakness, even among their own members
